review: I already have game consoles that can use streaming video apps, so that wasn't useful to me. However, Chromecast has proven itself to be the easiest way for me to connect the music I own from Google Music on my phone to my TV and stereo system. Instead of having to fiddle with plugs, buttons and leaving my phone on the stereo, I just use the app and can keep my phone on me.
author: M. Bosch

review: The chrome cast was easy to set up as well as easy to use.  The streams are very clear and watching videos is very easy.  You can control YouTube and Netflix from your phone or stream  videos from your Internet browser which is awesome.  Support for HBOGo is coming as well as other apps.  For $35 it's a no brainer,  and will only get better over time.

author: Amazon Customer

review: I travel a lot and carry an Apple TV.  The Chromecast has the same issue as the Apple TV, you can not log into the Hotel internet due to no active browser in the unit.  You can get past this if you have the IP address which is easy with an apple TV but you would have to write down the Chromecast.  Once at the hotel, call the hotels Internet Provider help line and let them you what you have and they will connect it via the IP address.  This was the whole reason to buy the Chromecast as you were supposed to connect via your cell phone and the reviews misled me in thinking I could sign into the hotels network via my phone for the Chromecast.  this simply isnt true.  I hope this helps other business travelers.  the unit is great for the house though and takes up no room and uses a usb from your TV (if you have one) to power it up.  You control it via apps from your phone.  Good but not 5 yet.
